title: Integrating Semrush with Looker Studio
content:
Integrating Semrush with Looker Studio

To configure the connection to Semrush, you need to authorize both your Google and Semrush accounts to access data and add it to Looker Studio.

Go to Looker Studio, create a new Data Source, and choose a needed connector. Then, select “Authorize” and “Allow” in the subsequent windows to make the connection.

Below are detailed descriptions of the Parameters for our Looker Studio connectors.

Parameters - Domain Analytics
Parameters - Position Tracking
Parameters - Site Audit
Corresponding API requests
Video tutorial - How to connect Domain Analytics to Looker Studio
Video tutorial - How to connect Site Audit to Looker Studio
Video tutorial - How to create widgets from Site Audit in Looker Studio
Video tutorial - How to blend data in Looker Studio to create the Rankings Distribution widget in Position Tracking

Check out Example reports for our Looker Studio connectors.

images.alt: Looker Studio authorize connector with two buttons. First grey authorized button, the second button is blue and labeled 'authorize'.
Parameters including: report type, database, domain. Two checkbox options include 'Allow 'Database' to be modified in reports' and 'allow 'domain' to be modified in reports'.
Semrush Domain Analytics connector with the list of fields. A red arrow points to the 'create report' button in the top right corner.
Parameters include: domain, domain type, report type, local pack settings, business name, filter by keyword, and filter by tags.
Connection fields for dimensions (including share of voice) and parameters.
Example of data in a table. The data shows date, visibility, and share of voice.
The top of the Position Tracking tool inside the Semrush platform. A red rectangle highlights the campaign ID (4405196) in the URL of the page.
Site Audit connection parameters for project settings. These include 'Site Audit Project' or 'Site Audit Project ID'.
The top of the Site Audit tool inside the Semrush platform. A red rectangle highlights the campaign ID (4405196) in the URL of the page.
Semrush Site Audit connector with the list of fields. A red arrow points to the 'create report' button in the top right corner.
